subject: Re: [junit] Testing methods randomly in groups using Junit
msgSnippet: Hi,   I am stuck while composing this program.I have to create a testHarness program for object oriented programs which automatically tests classes by
messageBody:
Hi,
  I am stuck while composing this program.I have to create a testHarness program for object oriented programs which automatically tests classes by instantiating them, selecting methods of these instantiated objects randomly or using some criteria, invoking them, and using the returned values as input parameters to invoke other methods.
 
Thanks!


--- On Tue, 14/4/09, David Saff <david@...> wrote:


From: David Saff <david@...>
Subject: Re: [junit] Testing methods randomly in groups using Junit
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Date: Tuesday, 14 April, 2009, 7:12 PM








Can you explain the reason behind this requirement a little more?

David Saff

On Mon, Apr 13, 2009 at 6:01 PM, sadia tahseen <sadia_in2006@ yahoo.co. in> wrote:
>
>
> --- On Mon, 13/4/09, sadia tahseen <sadia_in2006@ yahoo.co. in> wrote:
>
>
> From: sadia tahseen <sadia_in2006@ yahoo.co. in>
> Subject: Testing methods randomly in groups using Junit
> To: junit@yahoogroups. com
> Date: Monday, 13 April, 2009, 6:44 AM
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
> Hi,
>
> I have a question regarding testingUsing Junit ,I have to test the methods of a class in groups.
>
> For example,
> I have a class P and it has three methods, method int f(string) and the
> method float g(int) and the method string h(float), so I have another class testP which has to test the combinations h(g(f("first value from a file"))), h(g(f(h(g(f" first value from a file"))))))
> and so on.I can use some constraints for composition of functions but do not know how exactly to use them.
>
> My testP class should test as many combinations of methods as possible by
> composing them automatically.
>
> Please need help in this urgently.
>
> Thanks!
>
>
>
